comment: Professor Rogers was pretty good. Not too outstanding. Easy to understand, covered all the material, and let you know how to study for all the tests (including the final.) I would take a second class from him again.

Not that bad of a professor. He does seem to get confused over his notes sometimes. Tells you exactly what will be on the test, and works it out for you before the test. No surprises on any of the tests. Only uses the book for the 4 hw assignments he gave. Also had him for Operating Systems, just take notes of what he says and study to get an A.

The past reviews do not lie. I am quite sad that KSU has not let him go or reassigned him elsewhere. Many students are wasting their life, money, and sense of dedication by taking this man's class. I wish I could get my money back so I could donate it to charity; anything but this class.KSU please sit in on one of his 'lectures' and observe torture

I should note, this is firs time commenting here. And I have two university degree. His teaching skill is the same as a wall.I could say many many bad experiences with him, but this website only allows me 350 characters.Trust me, he is the Worst professor I have ever seen in my life. Just run away, dont waste your time and money.
Do not take this professor. He has no knowledge of what is in the book or what his class is about. His final is nothing like the exams. He knows nothing about Database Design at all. Stay Away!

DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY.First off, he cannot teach, he doesn't care about the students, and has 0 knowledge of any programming, database design, or anything about a computer at that. So you take exams through the semester and the final has nothing to do with anything you learn in the class. Don't expect to know whats on the final.

DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY!!!!!!! First off, he cannot teach, he doesn't care about the students, and has 0 knowledge of any programming, database design, or anything about a computer at that. So you take exams through the semester and the final has nothing to do with anything you learn in the class. Don't expect to know whats on the final!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Stay as far away from this guy as possible. Forgets that this is an INTRO course. Unless you have prior programming/java knowledge do NOT take this guy. Hardest class I have taken at KSU even harder than calc 2. Guy is new to teaching and it really shows.

Horrible. Supposed to be an intro level course, and his expectations are far beyond that. Lectures are him typing on the screen, going back and forth about what he thinks is correct. Exams are only writing complete programs, no multiple choice. Exam grading is ridiculous. Need prior knowledge of java to do well. Hardest B I've ever earned.

He gives clear lectures and  the labs are challenging, but not difficult. He is also open to questions, but his tests are ridiculously hard and he grades harshly. Not a good class to take if you're starting out. Need prior knowledge of java beforehand.

Not a good teacher at all if new to programming. He knows how to program, but not good at teaching it. The in class labs have nothing to do with what you learned for the day and You have to hand write code for the extremely hard tests. If you know how to program already then it shouldnt be as hard.

Unless you're already good at Java Programming and can pass his exams, without going to his lectures, I'd suggest you avoid this professor. This would have to be a refresher course for you, and not a beginner's course.

While professor Rogers has vastly improved from his first classes (according to ratings here), it is obvious he is still evolving. It is essential to follow along in class, and at the end ask as many questions as necessary for you to understand. He is completely willing to help, but learning Java is not an easy subject for anyone--even us geeks!

15% of your grade comes from: 1) small programs written each class; 2) about 8 other little programs given  thruout semester. All of which, btw, can be copied & pasted from someone else's code. My test grades were amazing & bc I didn't submit these useless assignments (u learn nothing from) I got a C.  Way to support the copy/paste students.

Dr. Rogers is new to teaching and it really shows. He doesn't seem to come to class prepare and a lot of the time I feel like he's talking to the board. This professor gave tests that were too difficult for the class since nobody understood the subject from his teaching. I received a low grade and I felt I understood the material as much as anyone.

While he tries to be helpful when giving examples, he is not clear most of the time. He does nothing but read from power point slides, and sometimes disagrees with the information or says, "I don't know why they did it that way". He gives no indication of what core concepts are, and honestly doesn't seem to like teaching.

This class in general is like learning a new language, it's going to be hard. HOWEVER, he is not the best teacher for the subject. He doesn't know how to get people started in the subject, and he constantly says 'we will come back to this.' Other students with other teachers seem to be doing better. If I had the choice, I would stay away. Please...

He is a horrible professor, especially if you're a beginner programmer or math major. Can't teach and can't explain anything. I have to read every page of every chapter and study completely on my own before the test. I have an A in the class but i have to study for hours before the test. No help at all. Take another teacher unless you're desperate.

Impossible to talk to. Doesn't care for his students.  Honestly the WORST teacher at KSU.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS TEACHER if you actually want to learn anything and enjoy it.  It's impossible to enjoy anything this guy teaches he's HORRIBLE!!!

I absolutely hate the way he teaches or lack of it.  He's the worst teacher I've ever had in anything.  He is not approachable at all and doesn't care about the students.  All his tests are extremely difficult because he doesn't teach well at all.  The only hope you will have is the textbook and even that can't save you from this HORRIBLE teacher.

To be quite honest with you he is probably the worst teacher at KSU. He has no clue how to teach, he gives the hardest assignments, and he is not helpful at all. Do yourself a favor and take another teacher. He could care less about the students. If you like teaching yourself then go right ahead and take this HORRIBLE Teacher.

He is the WORST professor ever!!! He has no idea what he is talking about and all the programs he tries to write in class are wrong. I really do not understand why they hire teachers like him. Taking this class with him is a waste of money and time. STAY AWAY FROM HIS CLASS!
The whole time I was lost. He makes you memorize lines of code for the tests and grades difficultly. HW is doable though, but It is a small percentage of your grade.
Very difficult teacher who has no clue how to teach. This is intro to cs not an advanced one. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this horrible teacher.

Hardest professor I ever took. I never knew that professors matter to get a good grade until I took his class. I'm in the first class he's ever taught . No one understands anythings. He made so many mistakes during class . And its like he is talking to him self . You need a better professor for this class

Oh my goodness. This is BY FAR the WORST professor I've ever had. I'm in his first class he's ever taught and he is absolutely awful. He is a terrible teacher and doesn't explain anything clear enough. However, the book is VERY helpful. That's where I get most of my learning done. You want a better professor for one of the hardest classes in CS
